title: Buehler 2013 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: From dry-farmed older vines, a field blend containing Petite Sirah, this affordable wine conjures memories of cherry-berry pie topped in vanilla, along with aromas of baked bread. A soft, grippy finish is seasoned in black pepper.

title: CàMaiol 2014 Molin  (Lugana)
description: Delicate but alluring scents of jasmine and aromatic herb float out of the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, zesty acidity offsets Golden Delicious apple, citrus zest and a note of bitter almond.

title: Umani Ronchi 2013 Plenio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
description: Subdued aromas of oak and citrus zest slowly take shape in the glass. The linear, svelte palate offers oak driven spice, lemon zest and yellow apple skin framed in racy acidity. A hint of toasted nut closes the finish.
region_1: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

title: Weibel Family 2012 Patriot Red (Mendocino County)
description: This is a big, full-bodied and nicely balanced wine, with hefty blackberry and cherry flavors matched to a firm texture of rich acidity and fine-grained tannins.

title: Weixelbaum 2015 Strassertaler Rosé (Niederösterreich)
description: Subdued lemon and forest fruit back up the bright, blush colour of this fruitful, almost fleshy rosé. While this is an easy-drinking party wine, it nonetheless finishes with real freshness and leaves you utterly quenched.

title: Tenuta Carretta 2013 Canorei  (Roero)
description: Fermented in barrel, this opens with aromas of pressed flower, vanilla and a whiff of toasted oak. The round palate offers yellow apple skin, oak, candied citrus peel and a hint of butterscotch alongside fresh acidity. A nutty note signals the close.

title: Sketchbook 2012 The Artist Red (Mendocino)
description: This nicely balanced, medium-bodied wine has fresh, bright flavors, a firm mouthfeel and enough complexity to demand attention. Unlike so many heavy, slightly sweet red blends this one is moderate and appetizingly dry.

title: Zantho 2014 Blaufränkisch (Burgenland)
description: The fleshy, generous blueberry and cherry fruit is made more vivid by white pepper notes. The palate is soft and rounded and full of easy-drinking joy. This is ready, bright and refreshing. Drink soon.

title: Zantho 2015 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: The freshly cut peel of Golden Delicious apples dominates this rounded but fresh Grüner. This has a slightly riper aspect than its counterparts from Lower Austria, but delivers a great punch of fresh, easy and appetizing fruit.

title: Zantho 2015 Pink Rosé (Burgenland)
description: Strawberry with a very faint touch of rhubarb makes for a very inviting nose. The palate continues the strawberry theme with a full, fresh and luscious but dry fruit expression. This is juicy, fleshy and moreish, drink soon.

title: Viticoltori Alto Adige 2012 Lagrein (Alto Adige)
description: Ripe blackberry, smoke and dark cooking spice aromas emerge on this savory red. On the easy-drinking, medium-bodied palate, round tannins support juicy plum, black cherry and a note of ground pepper. Enjoy soon.

title: Tinpot Hut 2015 McKee Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Marlborough)
description: This is a lovely example of Grüner's potential in New Zealand. Varietally distinctive celery leaf and stalk aromas and flavors are rounded out by hints of melon. There's a bit of creaminess on the midpalate, and while the finish is spicy, it's not quite white pepper. Still, a solid effort.

title: Seven Angels 2012 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Suave aromas of pepper, elderberry, lavender and a touch of snapped sagebrush show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers slightly sour black fruits of tart plum skin and boysenberry, rounded by a savory soy component.

title: Seven Oxen 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Dark alpine strawberry and black plum notes converge on the nose of this wine, which also offers a tart element. Vivacious black raspberry, pencil lead, crushed vanilla, clove and a slight herbal edge show on the palate, proving to be a more savory rather than fruity take on Zin.

title: Shooting Star 2013 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine smells and tastes clean and fresh, like green apples and chopped celery, then gains a little more heft and ripeness on the tongue to complete a good profile. It has crisp acidity and great balance, and will be very versatile with food.

title: La Raia 2013 Vigna della Madonnina Riserva  (Gavi)
description: Made with grapes cultivated with organic and biodynamic methods, this opens with aromas of pressed white flower, honey, toasted hazelnut and mature orchard fruit. The vibrant, linear palate doles out mature yellow apple, honeydew melon and white almond alongside bright acidity.

title: Quadrant 2012 BDX Red (Paso Robles)
description: Lighter aromas of turned earth, dried blueberries and beef jerky show on the nose of this blend of 34% Merlot, 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Petite Sirah and 15% Petit Verdot. The palate packs bright black raspberries and blackberries together with graphite and light cedar notes.

title: Turiya 2011 Solana VIneyard Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: This is a hearty wine on the nose, with sarsaparilla, red plum, rustic leather, dried strawberry and clove, showing a touch of age. A wide array of allspice, star anise and chicory spice pops on the palate, surrounded by dried red cherry, leather, iced coffee and turned-earth flavors. The acidity remains vibrant, but drink now.

title: San Silvestro 2015 Parvo  (Roero)
description: Delicate scents of white flower and apricot lead the nose. The bright, round palate doles out ripe peach, pear and a hint of hazelnut that lead to a fresh finish.

title: Winzerkeller Andau 2015 Rosé (Burgenland)
description: Fleshy strawberry notes vie with Golden Delicious apple flavors. The palate continues with this competition and throws in lemon freshness. This is easy, dry, fleshy and joyful. Drink soon.

title: Abbotts Delaunay 2013 Alto Stratus Carignan (Vin de France)
description: This is a lush, seductive Carignan, offering initial notes of pepper, licorice and baking spice that harmonize into the dense black-fruit core. The palate is round and mouthfilling, with ample acidity and medium tannins that lend a pleasant structure. Rich blackberry and black-cherry flavors are infused with wood and sweet spice tones, finishing long.

title: Admirable Family Vineyard 2014 Blanc & Blanc Viognier-Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Beatrice Cointreau is a 20th generation winemaker who moved to Malibu, where she makes this blend of 98% Viognier and 2% Chardonnay. It shows delicate lemon wedges, ripe nectarine and melon, lime zest and tangerine juice on the nose. The palate combines lime peels with riper peach and pineapple notes in the midpalate.

title: Alta Vista 2014 Estate Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe and floral like violets. The palate is more tannic than fully built. Berry and plum flavors show tea and light herbal notes, while flavors of coffee, thyme and plum share space on a bright finish.

title: Apriori 2014 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: A powerful waft of red fruit and tannin combine for an agreeable wine that'll do well across palates, appealing to those who like some weight and body to their wine and to others who like a wine priced under $30. Either way, give it some time to air in the glass: it's still very much a baby.

title: Balo 2014 Suitcase 828 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Big, rowdy flavors like rhubarb and black cherries seem to fill this medium-bodied wine to the rim. Made from an unusual clone smuggled into the U.S. and whole cluster fermentation, it has richness, moderate tannins, and a broad mouthfeel, with little oak flavor showing through.

title: Château les Valentines 2012 Red (Côtes de Provence)
description: Fermented and aged in wood, this wine is firm with dark tannins over blackberry fruits. It is ripe, generous and full bodied. The structure and the rich fruitiness will allow the wine to age further, so wait until 2017.

title: Commanderie de la Bargemone 2011 Cuvée Elisabeth Red (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: This wine aged for up to two years in wood, which shows in the toast flavors. The black-fruit flavors come from 50/50 Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah, as do the tannins. It is a dark wine, firm while having a juicy berry background. It could do with a few more months so wait until 2017.

title: Cruz de Comandante NV Estate Bottled Malbec-Tempranillo (Mendoza)
description: Medicinal aromas of latex and iodine mix with animal notes and wiry plum and cherry scents. Herbal, briny flavors of blueberry and plum are medicinal and herbal, while the finish on this Malbec-led blend feels chunky and tastes gamy.

title: De Fina 2013 Red (California)
description: This is a good example of a red blend based on Syrah and Zinfandel. An attractive, almost sweet oak aroma leads to generous, fresh berry flavors and a nicely firm texture. It feels smooth but slightly astringent, is full-bodied and well-balanced.

title: Demarie 2015  Roero
description: Honeysuckle, citrus blossom and an intriguing whiff of smoke open on the nose. The bright palate doles out creamy peach, mature pear and citrus zest while a light almond note backs up the finish. Fresh acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
